content.webTitle: Wood put on hold by Irish

fields.headline: Wood put on hold by Irish
fields.bodyText: Keith Wood has not been included in Ireland's squad to meet Italy on Saturday despite proving his fitness last week after a three-month lay-off with a calf strain. David Humphreys will take over the captaincy from the dropped Mick Galwey, who is replaced by Gary Longwell, writes Paul Rees. Wood's replacement at hooker, Frank Sheahan, has been relegated to the bench with Shane Byrne, 29, starting his first international. Simon Easterby replaces Eric Miller in the back row. France make two changes for the visit to Scotland, the second-row Fabien Pelous and the prop Jean-Baptiste Poux replacing David Aura-dou and Pieter de Veillers. Ireland squad: Dempsey (Leinster); Kelly (Munster), O'Driscoll , Horgan , Hickie (all Leinster); Humphreys (Ulster, capt), Stringer ; Clohessy (both Munster), Byrne (Leinster), Hayes (Munster), Longwell (Ulster), O'Kelly (Leinster); S Easterby (Llanelli), D Wallace (Munster), Foley (Munster). Replacements: Sheahan (Munster), P Wallace (Leinster), O'Connell (Munster), Miller (Leinster), G Easterby (Llanelli), O'Gara (Munster), Howe (Ulster). France: Brusque; Rougerie, Marsh, Traille, Bory; Merceron, Galthié (capt); Crenca, Ibanez, Poux, Pelous, Brouzet, Betsen, Magne, Harinordoquy. Replacements: Azam, Marconnet, Privat, Martin, Mignoni, Gelez, Marlu.
